const projectData = [{
  path: "/to-do",
  heading: "To Do",
  description: `The classic To Do app with a few twists! 
	This app includes a dark/light theme toggle 
	and is fully responsive for various device widths.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development / Responsive Design",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS / React",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/todo-app-main/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/todo-app-main",
  background: `This was my first time implementing a 'dark mode' feature.
  This required me to use the 'Theme Provider' from React's 'styled-components'
  library. (N.B. Since this project is hosted on GitHub pages, the backend 
  code is currently disabled meaning that your notes will not be saved 
  after refreshing/leaving the page).`,
  prevProjectName: "FAQ Page",
  prevProjectPath: "faq-page",
  nextProjectName: "Crowdfund",
  nextProjectPath: "crowdfund",

  preview2: null
}, {
  path: "/crowdfund",
  heading: "Crowdfund",
  description: `Fully responsive crowdfunding site that keeps track of pledges, 
	rewards & progress towards the project goal.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development / Responsive Design",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS / React",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/crowdfunding-product-page-main/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/crowdfunding-product-page-main",
  background: `This project challenged me to implement good modal design 
  as well as keep track of various state objects.`,
  prevProjectName: "To Do",
  prevProjectPath: "to-do",
  nextProjectName: "Signup Form",
  nextProjectPath: "signup-form",
  portfolio: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-portfolio.jpeg").default,
  hero: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-hero.jpeg").default,
  preview1: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-preview-1.jpeg").default,
  preview2: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-preview-2.jpeg").default
}, {
  path: "/signup-form",
  heading: "Sign Up Form",
  description: `Mock Sign Up form with custom client-side validation using JavaScript. 
	Fully responsive for mobile & desktop.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development / Responsive Design",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/intro-component-with-signup-form-master/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/intro-component-with-signup-form-master",
  background: `Since this was a simple project I wanted to challenge myself a little by not
  relying on external form libraries, instead choosing to write my own form validation and 
  error handling using vanilla JavaScript. Getting the error symbol to appear correctly inside 
  the form field proved to be a challenge!`,
  prevProjectName: "Crowdfund",
  prevProjectPath: "crowdfund",
  nextProjectName: "FAQ Page",
  nextProjectPath: "faq-page",

  preview1: require("./images/portfolio/signup/signup-preview-1.jpg").default,
  preview2: null
}, {
  path: "/faq-page",
  heading: "FAQ Page",
  description: `This project required me to build a fully responsive landing page to the designs 
  provided. I used HTML5, along with CSS Grid and JavaScript for the areas that 
  required interactivity, such as the testimonial slider.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/faq-accordion-card-main/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/faq-accordion-card-main",
  background: `This project was a front-end  challenge from Frontend Mentor. It’s a platform that 
  enables you to practice building websites to a design and project brief. Each challenge

sourcesContent:
const projectData = [
{	
	path: "/to-do",
	heading: "To Do",
	description: `The classic To Do app with a few twists! 
	This app includes a dark/light theme toggle 
	and is fully responsive for various device widths.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development / Responsive Design",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS / React",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/todo-app-main/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/todo-app-main",
  background: `This was my first time implementing a 'dark mode' feature.
  This required me to use the 'Theme Provider' from React's 'styled-components'
  library. (N.B. Since this project is hosted on GitHub pages, the backend 
  code is currently disabled meaning that your notes will not be saved 
  after refreshing/leaving the page).`,
  prevProjectName: "FAQ Page",
  prevProjectPath: "faq-page",
  nextProjectName: "Crowdfund",
  nextProjectPath: "crowdfund",

  portfolio: require("./images/portfolio/todo/todo-portfolio.jpeg").default,
  hero: require("./images/portfolio/todo/todo-hero.jpeg").default,
  preview1: require("./images/portfolio/todo/todo-preview-1.jpeg").default,
  preview2: null
},
{	
	path: "/crowdfund",
	heading: "Crowdfund",
	description: `Fully responsive crowdfunding site that keeps track of pledges, 
	rewards & progress towards the project goal.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development / Responsive Design",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS / React",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/crowdfunding-product-page-main/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/crowdfunding-product-page-main",
  background: `This project challenged me to implement good modal design 
  as well as keep track of various state objects.`,
  prevProjectName: "To Do",
  prevProjectPath: "to-do",
  nextProjectName: "Signup Form",
  nextProjectPath: "signup-form",

  portfolio: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-portfolio.jpeg").default,
  hero: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-hero.jpeg").default,
  preview1: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-preview-1.jpeg").default,
  preview2: require("./images/portfolio/crowdfund/crowdfund-preview-2.jpeg").default
},
{	
	path: "/signup-form",
	heading: "Sign Up Form",
	description: `Mock Sign Up form with custom client-side validation using JavaScript. 
	Fully responsive for mobile & desktop.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development / Responsive Design",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/intro-component-with-signup-form-master/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/intro-component-with-signup-form-master",
  background: `Since this was a simple project I wanted to challenge myself a little by not
  relying on external form libraries, instead choosing to write my own form validation and 
  error handling using vanilla JavaScript. Getting the error symbol to appear correctly inside 
  the form field proved to be a challenge!`,
  prevProjectName: "Crowdfund",
  prevProjectPath: "crowdfund",
  nextProjectName: "FAQ Page",
  nextProjectPath: "faq-page",

  portfolio: require("./images/portfolio/signup/signup-portfolio.jpg").default,
  hero: require("./images/portfolio/signup/signup-hero.jpg").default,
  preview1: require("./images/portfolio/signup/signup-preview-1.jpg").default,
  preview2: null
},
{	
	path: "/faq-page",
	heading: "FAQ Page",
	description: `This project required me to build a fully responsive landing page to the designs 
  provided. I used HTML5, along with CSS Grid and JavaScript for the areas that 
  required interactivity, such as the testimonial slider.`,
  skills: "Interaction Design / Front End Development",
  languages: "HTML / CSS / JS",
  website: "https://glenottley.github.io/faq-accordion-card-main/",
  code: "https://github.com/GlenOttley/faq-accordion-card-main",
  background: `This project was a front-end  challenge from Frontend Mentor. It’s a platform that 
  enables you to practice building websites to a design and project brief. Each challenge 
  includes mobile and desktop designs to show how the website should look at different 
  screen sizes. Creating these projects has helped me refine my workflow and solve 
  real-world coding problems. I’ve learned something new with each project, helping 
  me to improve and adapt my style.`,
  prevProjectName: "Signup Form",
  prevProjectPath: "signup-form",
  nextProjectName: "To Do",
  nextProjectPath: "to-do",

  portfolio: require("./images/portfolio/faq/faq-portfolio.jpg").default,
  hero: require("./images/portfolio/faq/faq-hero.jpg").default,
  preview1: require("./images/portfolio/faq/faq-preview-1.jpg").default,
  preview2: null
}
]

export default projectData
